author: ajsutton
content: Rewards will still wind up being withdrawn. The rule is just that if the validator is withdrawable, when it's turn comes around it's entire balance is withdrawn.

author: pietjepuk
content: Cool, i do wonder how this ties into reusing validator indices though. Apparently "withdrawal_done" is not enough to say whether a validator index is (or will be) in use. Related question, what happens if I deposit 32 ETH again to that exited/withdrawn validator? Will the deposit fail (losing me 32 ETH)? Will it reactivate the validator? Will it top up the balance but not reactivate (and balance gets automatically withdrawn to 0x01 address)?

author: ajsutton
content: It would increase the balance of the validator and then the next withdrawal sweep would withdraw those funds again.

author: ajsutton
content: The idea for reusing indices that I've heard is that they'd only be reused a fixed amount of time after the validator's withdrawable_epoch (remember that the `withdrawal_done` state doesn't actually exist in the beacon state - it's a synthetic interpretation of a few separate fields the REST API generates). That amount of time would be something like a year, so there's no chance the validator would still be in a sync committee.  Sending a deposit is done on public key which would have changed so it would actually just create a new validator with the old public key and a new index.
